Package com.scheduler.client.controller

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.scheduler.client.controller.CustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddCustomerController, ModifyCustomerController
public abstract class CustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Abstract controller class that provides common functionality to (is the Parent of) AddCustomerController and ModifyAppointmentController. The view file that this class controls is CustomerForm.fxml.
Author:
Dillon Christensen

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Called to initialize a controller after its root element has been completely processed. Initializes class members, sets up event handlers and loads values into countryChoiceBox.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root obect was not localized.

    • handleCountryChoiceBox

      protected void handleCountryChoiceBox(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles countryChoiceBox event. When a Country value is selected, the customerCountry class member is set and the selections for the divisionChoiceBox are dynamically generated.
      Parameters:
      event - ActionEvent of selection click

    • handleDivisionChoiceBox

      private void handleDivisionChoiceBox(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles divisionChoiceBox event. When a Division value is selected, the customerDivision class member is set.
      Parameters:
      event - ActionEvent of selection click

    • resetFieldFlags

      private void resetFieldFlags()
      Resets all field flags to not be visible.

    • checkRequiredFields

      protected void checkRequiredFields() throws RequiredFieldException
      Checks whether all required form fields are completed. Flags uncompleted fields and provides an error message if exception is thrown.
      Throws:
      RequiredFieldException - if required fields not completed

    • handleSubmitBtn

      protected abstract void handleSubmitBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
